verses.verse: If <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> shall steal <S%H1589><s%> an ox, <S%H7794><s%> or <S%H176><s%> a sheep, <S%H7716><s%> and kill <S%H2873><s%> it, or <S%H176><s%> sell <S%H4376><s%> it; he shall restore <S%H7999><s%> five <S%H2568><s%> oxen <S%H1241><s%> for an ox, <S%H7794><s%> and four <S%H702><s%> sheep <S%H6629><s%> for a sheep. <S%H7716><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> a thief <S%H1590><s%> be found <S%H4672><s%> breaking <S%H4290><s%> up, and be smitten <S%H5221><s%> that he die, <S%H4191><s%> there shall no <S%H369><s%> blood <S%H1818><s%> be shed for him.

If <S%H518><s%> the sun <S%H8121><s%> be risen <S%H2224><s%> on him, there shall be blood <S%H1818><s%> shed for him; for he should make full <S%H7999><s%> restitution; <S%H7999><s%> if <S%H518><s%> he have nothing, <S%H369><s%> then he shall be sold <S%H4376><s%> for his theft. <S%H1591><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> the theft <S%H1591><s%> be certainly found <S%H4672><s%> in his hand <S%H3027><s%> alive, whether <S%H5704><s%> it be ox, <S%H7794><s%> or <S%H5704><s%> ass, <S%H2543><s%> or <S%H5704><s%> sheep; <S%H7716><s%> he shall restore <S%H7999><s%> double. <S%H8147><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> shall cause a field <S%H7704><s%> or <S%H176><s%> vineyard <S%H3754><s%> to be eaten, <S%H1197><s%> and shall put <S%H7971><s%> in his beast, <S%H1165><s%> and shall feed <S%H1197><s%> in another <S%H312><s%> man's <S%H312><s%> field; <S%H7704><s%> of the best <S%H4315><s%> of his own field, <S%H7704><s%> and of the best <S%H4315><s%> of his own vineyard, <S%H3754><s%> shall he make restitution. <S%H7999><s%>

If <S%H3588><s%> fire <S%H784><s%> break <S%H3318><s%> out, and catch <S%H4672><s%> in thorns, <S%H6975><s%> so that the stacks <S%H1430><s%> of corn, or <S%H176><s%> the standing <S%H7054><s%> corn, <S%H7054><s%> or <S%H176><s%> the field, <S%H7704><s%> be consumed <S%H398><s%> therewith; he that kindled <S%H1197><s%> the fire <S%H1200><s%> shall surely make restitution. <S%H7999><s%>

If <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> shall deliver <S%H5414><s%> to his neighbor <S%H7453><s%> money <S%H3701><s%> or <S%H176><s%> stuff <S%H3627><s%> to keep, <S%H8104><s%> and it be stolen <S%H1589><s%> out of the man's <S%H376><s%> house; <S%H1004><s%> if <S%H518><s%> the thief <S%H1590><s%> be found, <S%H4672><s%> let him pay <S%H7999><s%> double. <S%H8147><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> the thief <S%H1590><s%> be not found, <S%H4672><s%> then the master <S%H1167><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> shall be brought <S%H7126><s%> to the judges, <S%H430><s%> to see whether <S%H518><s%> <S%H3808><s%> he have put <S%H7971><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> to his neighbor's <S%H7453><s%> goods. <S%H4399><s%>

For all <S%H3605><s%> manner <S%H1697><s%> of trespass, <S%H6588><s%> whether it be for ox, <S%H7794><s%> for ass, <S%H2543><s%> for sheep, <S%H7716><s%> for raiment, <S%H8008><s%> or for any <S%H3605><s%> manner of lost <S%H9><s%> thing which <S%H834><s%> another challenges <S%H559><s%> to be his, the cause <S%H1697><s%> of both <S%H8147><s%> parties shall come <S%H935><s%> before <S%H5704><s%> the judges; <S%H430><s%> and whom <S%H834><s%> the judges <S%H430><s%> shall condemn, <S%H7561><s%> he shall pay <S%H7999><s%> double <S%H8147><s%> to his neighbor. <S%H7453><s%>

If <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> deliver <S%H5414><s%> to his neighbor <S%H7453><s%> an ass, <S%H2543><s%> or <S%H176><s%> an ox, <S%H7794><s%> or <S%H176><s%> a sheep, <S%H7716><s%> or <S%H176><s%> any <S%H3605><s%> beast, <S%H929><s%> to keep; <S%H8104><s%> and it die, <S%H4191><s%> or <S%H176><s%> be hurt, <S%H7665><s%> or <S%H176><s%> driven <S%H7617><s%> away, no <S%H369><s%> man seeing <S%H7200><s%> it:

Then shall an oath <S%H7621><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> be between <S%H996><s%> them both, <S%H8147><s%> that he has not put <S%H7971><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> to his neighbor's <S%H7453><s%> goods; <S%H4399><s%> and the owner <S%H1167><s%> of it shall accept <S%H3947><s%> thereof, and he shall not make it good. <S%H7999><s%>
And if <S%H518><s%> it be stolen <S%H1589><s%> from him, he shall make restitution <S%H7999><s%> to the owner <S%H1167><s%> thereof.
If <S%H518><s%> it be torn <S%H2963><s%> in pieces, then let him bring <S%H935><s%> it for witness, <S%H5707><s%> and he shall not make good <S%H7999><s%> that which was torn. <S%H2966><s%>

And if <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> borrow <S%H7592><s%> ought of his neighbor, <S%H7453><s%> and it be hurt, <S%H7665><s%> or <S%H176><s%> die, <S%H4191><s%> the owner <S%H1167><s%> thereof being not with it, he shall surely make it good. <S%H7999><s%>

But if <S%H518><s%> the owner <S%H1167><s%> thereof be with it, he shall not make it good: <S%H7999><s%> if <S%H518><s%> it be an hired <S%H7916><s%> thing, it came <S%H935><s%> for his hire. <S%H7939><s%>

And if <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> entice <S%H6601><s%> a maid <S%H1330><s%> that is not betrothed, <S%H781><s%> and lie <S%H7901><s%> with her, he shall surely endow <S%H4117><s%> her to be his wife. <S%H802><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> her father <S%H1><s%> utterly refuse <S%H3985><s%> to give <S%H5414><s%> her to him, he shall pay <S%H8254><s%> money <S%H3701><s%> according to the dowry <S%H4119><s%> of virgins. <S%H1330><s%>
You shall not suffer a witch <S%H3784><s%> to live. <S%H2421><s%>
Whoever <S%H3605><s%> lies <S%H7901><s%> with a beast <S%H929><s%> shall surely be put to death. <S%H4191><s%>
He that sacrifices <S%H2076><s%> to any god, <S%H430><s%> save <S%H1115><s%> to the LORD <S%H3068><s%> only, <S%H905><s%> he shall be utterly destroyed. <S%H2763><s%>

You shall neither <S%H3808><s%> vex <S%H3238><s%> a stranger, <S%H1616><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> oppress <S%H3905><s%> him: for you were strangers <S%H1616><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>
You shall not afflict <S%H6031><s%> any <S%H3605><s%> widow, <S%H490><s%> or fatherless <S%H3490><s%> child.
If <S%H518><s%> you afflict <S%H6031><s%> them in any wise, <S%H6031><s%> and they cry <S%H6817><s%> at all to me, I will surely hear <S%H8085><s%> their cry; <S%H6818><s%>

And my wrath <S%H639><s%> shall wax hot, <S%H2734><s%> and I will kill <S%H2026><s%> you with the sword; <S%H2719><s%> and your wives <S%H802><s%> shall be widows, <S%H490><s%> and your children <S%H1121><s%> fatherless. <S%H3490><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> you lend <S%H3867><s%> money <S%H3701><s%> to any of my people <S%H5971><s%> that is poor <S%H6041><s%> by you, you shall not be to him as an usurer, <S%H5383><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> shall you lay <S%H7760><s%> on him usury. <S%H5392><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> you at all take <S%H2254><s%> your neighbor's <S%H7453><s%> raiment <S%H8008><s%> to pledge, <S%H2254><s%> you shall deliver <S%H7725><s%> it to him by that the sun <S%H8121><s%> goes <S%H935><s%> down: <S%H935><s%>

For that is his covering <S%H3682><s%> only, <S%H905><s%> it is his raiment <S%H8071><s%> for his skin: <S%H5785><s%> wherein <S%H4100><s%> shall he sleep? <S%H7901><s%> and it shall come <S%H1961><s%> to pass, when <S%H3588><s%> he cries <S%H6817><s%> to me, that I will hear; <S%H8085><s%> for I am gracious. <S%H2587><s%>
You shall not revile <S%H7043><s%> the gods, <S%H430><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> curse <S%H779><s%> the ruler <S%H5387><s%> of your people. <S%H5971><s%>

You shall not delay <S%H309><s%> to offer the first <S%H4395><s%> of your ripe fruits, <S%H4395><s%> and of your liquors: <S%H1831><s%> the firstborn <S%H1060><s%> of your sons <S%H1121><s%> shall you give <S%H5414><s%> to me.

Likewise <S%H3651><s%> shall you do <S%H6213><s%> with your oxen, <S%H7794><s%> and with your sheep: <S%H6629><s%> seven <S%H7651><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> it shall be with his dam; <S%H517><s%> on the eighth <S%H8066><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> you shall give <S%H5414><s%> it me.

And you shall be holy <S%H6944><s%> men <S%H582><s%> to me: neither <S%H3808><s%> shall you eat <S%H398><s%> any flesh <S%H1320><s%> that is torn <S%H2966><s%> of beasts <S%H2966><s%> in the field; <S%H7704><s%> you shall cast <S%H7993><s%> it to the dogs. <S%H3611><s%>
